messages.content: 9-1-1, what's your emergency?
This is Maria Sanchez, 9-1-1 Communications Record Custodian. I have a situation to report from the Miami Beach area.
Can you provide more details about the situation?
The incident occurred on August 6, 2013, around 5:13:32 AM. It involves a suspect who was last seen running southbound on Collins Avenue from 71st Street.
Can you describe the suspect?
The suspect is a 6'1" mulatto male, wearing a cream-colored shirt and white dreadlocks.
Understood. Are there any units currently responding to this?
Yes, units are in pursuit. The suspect was last seen running southbound past the 7000 block of Collins.
Alright, is there a containment perimeter setup for this suspect?
Not at this time. The officers are currently canvassing the area.
Please advise if you need additional support or units.
We may need additional units to set up a perimeter if the suspect is not located soon.
Understood. I'll dispatch additional units to assist in setting up a perimeter. Do you have any updates on the suspect's movements?
The suspect was seen again at 6940 Harding Avenue, heading northbound.
Copy that. Units have been directed to Harding Avenue. Is there a specific location we should focus on?
Focus on the City National Bank's rear parking lot. The suspect just jumped a fence there.
Roger. Units will concentrate on the rear parking lot of City National Bank. Any further updates?
The suspect is now in custody at 71st Street and Harding.
Understood. Is medical assistance required?
Yes, the suspect might be having a seizure. Requesting Fire Rescue on a Code 3.
Copy that. Dispatching Fire Rescue to 71st Street and Harding.
Fire Rescue is en route. ETA is 6-7 minutes.
Acknowledged. Please notify us once they have arrived.
Fire Rescue has arrived and is attending to the suspect.
Roger that. Any further assistance required at this moment?
No, we're all set. Thank you.
You're welcome. Stay safe out there.
